intro: Reseda aucheri subsp. rechingeri, commonly known as the Alpine Reseda, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine meadows and rocky slopes. Its foliage is typically narrow and grass-like, contributing to its ornamental value in garden settings.
